subject: statistics
title: Quantiles and Percentiles
contentHtml:
Quantiles and percentiles are measures of central tendency that help us understand the distribution of a dataset.

A quantile is a value that divides the data into equal-sized groups, while a percentile is a specific percentage point (e.g., 25th percentile) that represents a certain proportion of the data.
name: Quantile Formula" },
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the median", "mathHtml": "\[Q_2 = \text{value at } 0.5\]", "explanation": "The median is the middle value when the data is sorted."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Find the first quartile (25th percentile)", "mathHtml": "", "explanation": "This is the value below which 25% of the data lies."} ],
intuition: Quantiles and percentiles provide a way to summarize large datasets, helping us understand patterns and outliers.

subject: statistics
title: Quantiles and Percentiles
contentHtml:
Quantiles and percentiles are essential concepts in descriptive statistics that help us understand the distribution of a dataset.

A quantile is a value that divides the data into equal-sized groups, while a percentile is a specific percentage point (e.g., 25th percentile) that represents a certain proportion of the data.
name: Quantile Formula
problemHtml: Suppose we have the following dataset: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]. Find the 25th percentile.

steps.explanation: To find the 25th percentile, we need to order the data from smallest to largest.

intuition: Quantiles and percentiles help us understand the distribution of a dataset by providing a snapshot of the data at specific points.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, quantiles can be used as a feature in regression models to capture non-linear relationships.

subject: statistics
title: Quantiles and Percentiles
contentHtml:
Quantiles and percentiles are essential concepts in descriptive statistics that help us understand the distribution of a dataset.

In this formula card, we'll explore the main ideas behind these concepts and how to apply them.
name: Quartile Formula
problemHtml: Suppose we have a dataset of exam scores with the following values: 60, 70, 80, 90, 100.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the median", "mathHtml": "\\[Q_2 = x_{n/2}\]", "explanation": "The median is the middle value when the data is sorted."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Calculate the first quartile (Q1)", "mathHtml": "\\[Q_1 = x_{(n+1)/4}\]", "explanation": "Q1 is the value below which 25% of the data falls."} ],
intuition: Quantiles and percentiles help us understand the distribution of a dataset by providing a snapshot of the data's shape.
